title: The Tao That Can Be Spoken
content: The Tao that can be spoken is not the eternal Tao. The name that can be named is not the eternal name.

title: The Way That Can Be Spoken
content: The Tao that can be spoken is not the eternal Tao. The name that can be named is not the eternal name. The nameless is the beginning of heaven and earth. The named is the mother of ten thousand things.

title: The Wisdom of Non-Action
content: When people see some things as beautiful, other things become ugly. When people see some things as good, other things become bad. Therefore the sage is guided by what he feels and not by what he sees.

title: The Highest Good is Like Water
content: The highest good is like water, which nourishes all things and does not compete with them. It dwells in places that all disdain. That is why it is so near to Tao.

title: The Usefulness of Emptiness
content: Thirty spokes share the wheel's hub; it is the center hole that makes it useful. Shape clay into a vessel; it is the space within that makes it useful. We join spokes together in a wheel, but it is the center hole that makes the wagon move.

title: The Best Leaders
content: The best leaders are those who the people hardly know exist. The next best is a leader who is loved and praised. Next comes the one who is feared. The worst one is the leader that is despised.

title: The Tao Follows Nature
content: There was something formless and perfect before the universe was born. It is serene. Empty. Solitary. Unchanging. It could be the mother of the universe. I don't know its name, so I call it the Tao.

title: Self-Knowledge and Victory
content: Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom. Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power. If you realize that you have enough, you are truly rich.

title: The Power of Stillness
content: The Tao does nothing, yet nothing is left undone. If you can grasp this, you will understand that when you do nothing in a state of complete trust, everything is done for you.

title: Overcoming the Hardest
content: The softest thing in the universe overcomes the hardest thing in the universe. That without substance can enter where there is no room. Hence I know the value of non-action.

title: The Mystery of Virtue
content: Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know. Stop up the openings, close down the doors, rub off the sharp edges. Unravel the knots, soften the glare, settle the dust.

title: The Virtue of Humility
content: A great nation is like a great man: When he makes a mistake, he realizes it. Having realized it, he admits it. Having admitted it, he corrects it. He considers those who point out his faults as his most benevolent teachers.

title: The Three Treasures
content: I have three treasures which I hold and keep. The first is mercy; the second is economy; the third is daring not to be ahead of others. From mercy comes courage; from economy comes generosity; from humility comes leadership.

title: The Flexibility of Life
content: When people are born they are supple and weak; when they die, they are stiff and strong. When things are alive they are tender and pliant; when they are dead, they are brittle and hard.

title: The Way of the Sage
content: Truthful words are not beautiful; beautiful words are not truthful. Good words are not persuasive; persuasive words are not good. He who knows that enough is enough will always have enough.

title: The Journey of a Thousand Miles
content: A journey of a thousand miles begins with one step. The tree that is taller than others is destroyed by the wind. Therefore the sage is guided by what he feels and not by what he sees.
